str2: From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From the same as makrothumos; to be long-spirited, i.e. forbearing or patient.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be kind (full of service to others), gentle. Middle voice from chrestos; to show oneself useful, i.e. Act benevolently.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From zelos; to have warmth of feeling for or against.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To boast, vaunt myself. Middle voice from perperos; to boast.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phusis in the primary sense of blowing; to inflate, i.e. make proud.
